newsitem.title: ICELAND: ICELAND ALUMINIUM SMELTER STARTS 60,000 T BOOST.
newsitem.headline: ICELAND ALUMINIUM SMELTER STARTS 60,000 T BOOST.

text.p: An expansion at Iceland's Straumsuk aluminium smelter, run by Alusuisse-Lonza Holdings AG, began on July 1 and will take three months to complete, a company spokesman said on Thursday.
A third potline is being added to the 100,000 tonnes a year smelter to boost capacity to 160,000 tonnes.
Rannveig Rist, managing director of Icelandic Aluminium, a wholly subsidiary of Alusuisse-Lonza Holdings, said the smelter started adding one or two new pots a day from July 1.
She told Reuters it would take about three months before all 160 new pots were on line.
The smelter is planning an official opening of the new potline on October 17.
